alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Genesee; Livingston; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 19 at 11:20PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BRING ABOUT A 2 HOURS BURST OF SNOW TO WESTERN NEW YORK... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1118 PM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Byron to 6 miles southwest of Westfield, or moving south of the Buffalo and Rochester metro areas. The bans is moving south at 20 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Jamestown, Batavia, Dunkirk, Fredonia, Hamburg, East Aurora, Darien Lakes State Park, Letchworth State Park, Boston, Eden, Marilla, Springville, Perry, Warsaw, Bennington, Colden, Orchard Park, Westfield, Lakewood and Mount Morris. This includes the following highways... Interstate 390 near exit 6. Interstate 90 between exits 57A and 61. Interstate 86 between exits 4 and 16. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
